intro: Amitostigma gracile, commonly known as the slender larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
